topics.title: Trans-Tasman Test Tour
topics.summary: Australia finalises plans for the two-Test swing through Wellington and Christchurch with selection intrigue across the pace ranks.
topics.curatedCopy:
## Selection calls and conditions
Selectors have opted to rest Josh Hazlewood for the opener, elevating Lance Morris after his Shield heroics. Scott Boland stays on standby as conditions at the Basin Reserve hint at seam movement early before flattening out.

### Key talking points
- Who partners Marnus Labuschagne at first drop if Steven Smith remains as makeshift opener.
- Balance of the attack with Nathan Lyon backed for long spells.
- Cameron Green's dual role covering middle-order stability and fourth seamer duties.

callouts.title: Weather watch
callouts.markdown: Wellington forecast suggests showers on days two and three â€” reserve day contingencies already flagged.

callouts.title: Broadcast guide
callouts.markdown: Fox Cricket and Kayo to simulcast from 9:30am AEDT with SEN radio syndicating ball-by-ball commentary.

events.title: Aussies dominate Lincoln warm-up
events.description: Practice match sees Lance Morris clock 150kph while Cameron Bancroft posts a rapid 80, nudging selection conversations.

events.title: Hazlewood rested, Boland flies in
events.description: Australia shuffle the pace stocks with workload management in mind ahead of a packed winter schedule.

events.title: Smith to continue as Test opener
events.description: Head coach Andrew McDonald backs Steven Smith to open alongside Usman Khawaja with Labuschagne locked at three.

topics.title: WNCL Final Countdown
topics.summary: Breakers and Tigers renew their rivalry in a North Sydney Oval finale with star-studded line-ups and sell-out momentum.
topics.curatedCopy:
## Finals fever
NSW regain Alyssa Healy while Elyse Villani returns for Tasmania after hamstring tightness. Both camps emphasise powerplay match-ups with cross-breeze expected to favour attacking stroke-play.

### Tactical trends
1. How Belinda Vakarewa and Lauren Cheatle manage new-ball overs.
2. Middle-order acceleration with Phoebe Litchfield floating to exploit match-ups.
3. Fielding units rehearsing aerial catching under lights for a twilight finish.

callouts.title: Ticket pulse
callouts.markdown: Only 1,200 general admission seats remain with family bays nearly exhausted.

events.title: Healy cleared for WNCL decider
events.description: NSW medical staff confirm Healy's return, giving the Breakers a top-order boost.

events.title: Villani passes late fitness test
events.description: Tasmania's skipper declared ready after clearing match-eve mobility drills.

events.title: Broadcast upgrade adds spidercam
events.description: Cricket Australia and Fox confirm enhanced coverage elements including spidercam and player mic-ups.

topics.title: Big Bash List Shuffle
topics.summary: BBL and WBBL clubs begin list management with marquee targets, trade whispers, and coaching moves shaping the off-season.
topics.curatedCopy:
## Contract window opens
Clubs have two weeks to finalise retentions before marquee offers to overseas stars go live. Brisbane Heat and Hobart Hurricanes head the queue for top-order finishers, while Melbourne Stars search for a frontline spinner.

### Moves to monitor
- Heat plotting a multi-year offer to English powerhouse Liam Livingstone.
- Hurricanes sounding out South African quick Shabnim Ismail for dual WBBL duties.
- Cricket Australia canvassing fans on expanded regional festival rounds.

callouts.title: Regulation refresh
callouts.markdown: Revised contracting rules allow one additional overseas replacement slot subject to CA approval.

events.title: Heat confirm Wade Seccombe extension
events.description: Brisbane extend their coach through BBL|15, reinforcing stability ahead of contracting announcements.

events.title: Hurricanes narrow marquee shortlist
events.description: Hobart open talks with two overseas finishers while eyeing a local quick through trade mechanisms.

events.title: Regional festival round pitched
events.description: Cricket Australia surveys fans on taking WBBL double-headers to Launceston and Cairns.

items.title: Morris and Bancroft star in Lincoln tour match
items.content: Fast bowler Lance Morris and opener Cameron Bancroft press their claims as Australia cruise through their New Zealand hit-out.

items.title: Bancroft firms for Test recall after NZ warm-up
items.content: Selectors hint that Bancroft could slot in should Australia reshuffle the top order in Wellington.

items.title: Hazlewood rested for opener as Boland called in
items.content: Workload management sees Hazlewood miss Wellington with Boland linking with the squad as cover.

items.title: Smith to persist as opener for Kiwi Tests
items.content: Coach Andrew McDonald says the Smith-Khawaja partnership will open in Wellington with Labuschagne anchored at three.

items.title: Healy cleared to lead Breakers in WNCL final
items.content: NSW confirm Alyssa Healy will take the gloves after clearing concussion protocols ahead of the decider.

items.title: Villani fitness tick boosts Tigers hopes
items.content: Tasmania captain Elyse Villani wins her race against time to feature in Saturday's showdown.

items.title: Spidercam to debut for women's domestic final
items.content: Enhanced broadcast coverage promised as Cricket Australia invests in elevated production for the women's final.

items.title: Heat lock in coach Wade Seccombe through 2026
items.content: Brisbane Heat extend their head coach as they eye marquee signings in the opening of the contracting window.

items.title: Hurricanes hunt finisher as contracting window opens
items.content: Hobart Hurricanes zero in on overseas finisher options while canvassing a local quick via trade.

items.title: Fans asked to vote on WBBL festival rounds
items.content: Cricket Australia surveys supporters on potential regional festival weekends in Launceston and Cairns.
